title: Naveed Qamar elected President of PGA
content:
ISLAMABAD, Aug 08 (APP): Parliamentarians from across all parties in both Houses of Parliament Thursday elected Syed Naveed Qamar as the President of the Parliamentarians for Global Action (PGA).
PGA is a non-governmental, multi-party international network of legislators acting in their individual capacities to contribute towards the creation of a rules-based international order for a more equitable, safe, sustainable, and democratic world.
Upon his election, the newly elected PGA President, Syed Naveed Qamar, underscored the significance of the organization and its remarkable achievements since its establishment in 1978. He encouraged parliamentarians to join the PGA and actively contribute to advancing human rights and the rule of law.
Addressing the plight of the innocent Palestinian people, Qamar highlighted that such forums provide a crucial platform to collectively raise voices for victims of aggression and barbarism.
He also informed the participants that the National Assembly of Pakistan would be hosting the 45th Annual Forum of the PGA, alongside the 13th Consultative Assembly of Parliamentarians on the International Criminal Court and the Rule of Law (CAP-ICC), from October 28-29, 2024, in Islamabad.
Parliamentarians congratulated Syed Naveed Qamar on his election to the prestigious office of PGA President, noting that his achievement is a source of pride not only for him but also for the entire parliament and the nation.
The parliamentarians expressed great interest in PGAâ€™s activities and assured their full support towards making the October conference in Pakistan a success.
The meeting was attended by the Minister for Law & Justice, Senator Azam Nazeer Tarar, and parliamentarians from both Houses of Parliament, with the virtual presence of First Lady Ms. Aseefa Bhutto Zardari and other renowned parliamentarian.
